Q: Transposing a matrix from a 2D array A:

Simple logic with reversing the loop logic of running first outer loop for columns and then the inner loop for rows.

 for(int j = 0 ; j < m ; j++){ // outer loop for column 
            for(int i = 0 ; i< n; i++){ // inner loop for row
                System.out.print(arr[i][j] + " ");
            }
            System.out.println();
        }

output 

2 3 - 2 * 3 matrix

matrix elements to transpose from 2 * 3 to 3 * 2
1 1 1
2 2 2

transpose matrix 3 * 2
1 2 
1 2 
1 2

This is beginner friendly logic with Time complexity - O(n * m) and space complexity - O(1), and this code will work for any n * m matrix.

Q: How do i hide/show Edit button command based on a criteria A:

I can give you a hand up via an example. My goal is to allow the people with my ABC App Admin security role to see the 'Activate' ribbon button only.

Inside the ribbon button editor of the App designer, since it can check if the current user has the permission to delete table records using power FX expressions on the top and it's the only difference between the admin role and user role (in my case), I can only show the activate button to those who has the permission to delete records.

FX formula:

Visible = If(DataSourceInfo('Your Table', DataSourceInfo.DeletePermission), true, false)
